about.heroSubtitle: The apocalyptic survival plan that tastes damn good
about.mainTitle: Artisanal Beers: The Apocalyptic Survival Plan (That Tastes Damn Good)
about.mainQuote: When the apocalypse happens, we can debate it over a glass of beer. Forget our problems for a while. Plan the new world. Or just laugh at how ridiculous it all got. Either way, we'll have something worth raising a glass to.
about.intro: Because here's the thing: artisanal beers are built for thriving, not just surviving.

section1.title: No Unwanted Chemicals – Just Pure, Earth-Grown Goodness
section1.content: Mass-market brews often come loaded with stabilizers, preservatives, and mystery additives to survive endless shipping and shelf life. Craft beers? Mostly water, malt, hops, yeast (and maybe some fun local twists). What you get is honest flavor from real ingredients—no junk you wouldn't want in your body when the world goes sideways (or even on a normal Tuesday). Clean living in a pint.

section2.title: The Fruits of the Earth, Crafted by Real People
section2.content: Artisanal brewing celebrates what the land and human ingenuity can do together. Bold hops, rich malts, seasonal experiments—whether from nearby Aude microbrasseries or masterful Belgian or international artisans. It's a reminder that quality doesn't need a global factory; it thrives in small batches, skilled hands, and imagination. Post-crisis or pre-, that's the life we want: flavorful, natural, and full of character.

section3.title: Saucisson, Bread, and Good Company – The Real Survival Kit
section3.content: Pair that beer with a platter of saucisson, fresh bread, maybe some local cheeses or charcuterie. Simple, hearty, timeless. In our vaulted cellars, you're not just drinking—you're gathering with a loose tribe of people who get it: good beer, good food, good stories. No matter what the outside world throws at us, we adapt, enjoy, and keep the fire (or the tap) going.

about.ctaTitle: Join the Vault Tribe: Survive, Thrive, and Enjoy the Ride
about.ctaText: We're not doomsday preppers. We're just folks who prefer real over processed, flavor over filler, and community over convenience. When things get tough (or stay blissfully normal), you'll find us here—pouring honest brews in 13th-century stone, sharing platters, swapping tales, and toasting to whatever comes next.
about.ctaSubtext: Come for the beer that might outlast the apocalypse. Stay for the vibe that makes every day feel like a win.

history.title: Echoes of the Vaults
history.content:
Under the streets of the Bourg de Narbonne, L'Antre's cellars keep secrets dating back more than seven centuries. Built around 1250 as part of the Maison Consulaire du Bourg—an administrative and commercial center—these vaults have seen merchants, consuls, and perhaps fleeing shadows pass through.

Whispers speak of hidden passages to the Robine (ancient bed of the Aude), refuges for Cathars during the Albigensian Crusade, a consul who supposedly buried a lucky (and cursed) gold coin in the foundations, and tunnels extending to the Abbey of Fontfroide.

Today, these same stones shelter artisanal beers, saucisson platters, and conversations that defy time. L'Antre isn't just a bar—it's a refuge where history is drunk in 13th-century stone.
